comments: Alternatively, a(n) = smallest k such that n+k is prime. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 18 2015Except for a(0) and a(1), a(n) is the least k such that the GCD( n!, n+k) = 1. - _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 05 2010This sequence uses the "strictly larger" variant A151800 of the nextprime function, rather than A007918. Therefore all terms are positive and a(n)=1 iff n+1 is a prime. - _M. F. Hasler_, Sep 09 2015
links: Brăduţ Apostol, Laurenţiu Panaitopol, Lucian Petrescu, László Tóth, Some properties of a sequence defined with the aid of prime numbers, arXiv:1503.01086 [math.NT], 2015.
mathematica: f[n_] := NextPrime@n - n; Array[f, 105, 0] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 05 2010 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: Incorrect comment removed by _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 18 2010
More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 05 2010
